items.text: goes for another pull but this time the ball skips through to the keeper
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off, shovels it over cow corner
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: short of good length, whips it from outside off, to deep midwicket
short of a length, angled across off, it's a cutter, he has a feel for it and misses
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Samuels, no run

items.text: swings and misses at another slower one
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Samuels, no run

items.text: tries to pull but gets an underedge that evades a diving keeper to deep fine leg
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Samuels, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length, cuts away outside off, slower again, has a feel for it and sends an outside edge through to the keeper
items.postText: Right then, I'm singing out. Saurabh will take you through.

dismissal.text: MN Samuels c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Mustafizur Rahman 26 (45b 2x4 1x6) SR: 57.77

items.text: length ball on off, punched to extra cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.text: fuller on the stumps, driven back past the bowler for a couple
length ball, he goes back in his crease to tap it to long-on
items.postText: Samuels' falling might not be the worst thing for West Indies. He was struggling to up the rate, and Hetmyer is just the kind of batsman West Indies need now.

items.text: fuller ball on off stump, steered to point
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: dropped at short fine leg Short ball on leg, he swivels to pull it, Imrul Kayes found the ball coming to him almost before he was ready for it, burst right through of his hands, hit him on the chest and rolls away. Kayes seems to have been hit rather hard by that ball, and he's going off the field. It was well struck by Hetmyer, which contributed to it coming so quickly that Kayes couldn't react in time to catch it
good short ball, rears up from back of a length and surprises Hetymyer a bit, who gets his bat up at the last moment to defend tentatively
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, no run

items.preText: Anupam: "I believe that WI can really benefit from Hetmyer batting at no.3 or 4 with Samuels following him. Hope and Hetmyer can teh Rohit and Virat of WI batting lineup with a little more concistency. What are your thoughts ?" - I would agree. Hetmyer needs to bat higher up, I think.
items.text: fuller ball on off, comes forward and drives it nicely through extra cover, showing the full face of the bat before opening it to get the placement right
back of a length, he stands tall in his crease and punches to cover
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.preText: Moon Sajjad: "@Akash; Singing out or signing out?" - he's out of earshot now, but it must have been 'Auld Lang Syne'...
items.text: slower ball on the stumps, he was into the drive a bit early and the ball hung in the air for a while, but dropped halfway down the pitch. Mashrafe fields
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hope, no run

items.text: comes down the track and the bowler follows him to almost york him. Well adjusted by Hope though, who tickles it round the corner. Poor effort by short fine leg, what should have been one, turns into three
misses with the attempted dab to third man. Slower ball in the channel outside off
items.shortText: Mashrafe Mortaza to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: fuller length angling into the pads, and tucked to square leg

items.preText: Firoz Dhanani: "Seeing as Mehedi Hasan has dismissed Hetmyer 5 out of 5 times in this series, WI should have held him back for the death overs and sent one of the tail-enders who did well in the last game as a pinch hitter" - Could be a case for that. Mehidy has only 3 overs left though
items.text: Biff - take that slower one on a length, he frees his arms and hits it straight back over the bowler and over the straight boundary rope. He's not going to hang around
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, SIX runs

items.text: over the bowler's head once again with a horizontal bat, but not as well timed, and he gets a couple
very full on the stumps, he waits in his crease and just opens the face of the bat to run it to third man
full length outside off, driven crisply to cover
stays in his crease and late cuts it past the keeper very fine to third man. Mustafizur running in stops the ball with his boot, and over-runs it, but comes back to throw the ball in. Saved a couple
